10447: Thir own Faith not anothers: for on Earth
10448: Who against Faith and Conscience can be heard
10451: On all who in the worship persevere
10452: Of Spirit and Truth; the rest, farr greater part,
10453: Will deem in outward Rites and specious formes
10455: Bestuck with slandrous darts, and works of Faith
10456: Rarely be found: so shall the World goe on,
10457: To good malignant, to bad men benigne,
10458: Under her own waight groaning, till the day
10459: Appeer of respiration to the just,
10460: And vengeance to the wicked, at return
10461: Of him so lately promis'd to thy aid,
10462: The Womans seed, obscurely then foretold,
10463: Now amplier known thy Saviour and thy Lord,
10464: Last in the Clouds from Heav'n to be reveald
10465: In glory of the Father, to dissolve
10466: *Satan* with his perverted World, then raise
10467: From the conflagrant mass, purg'd and refin'd,
10468: New Heav'ns, new Earth, Ages of endless date
10469: Founded in righteousness and peace and love,
10470: To bring forth fruits Joy and eternal Bliss.
10472: How soon hath thy prediction, Seer blest,
10473: Measur'd this transient World, the Race of time,
10474: Till time stand fixt: beyond is all abyss,
10475: Eternitie, whose end no eye can reach.
10476: Greatly instructed I shall hence depart,
10477: Greatly in peace of thought, and have my fill
10478: Of knowledge, what this vessel can containe;
10479: Beyond which was my folly to aspire.
10480: Henceforth I learne, that to obey is best,
10481: And love with feare the onely God, to walk
10482: As in his presence, ever to observe
10483: His providence, and on him sole depend,
10484: Merciful over all his works, with good
10485: Still overcoming evil, and by small
10486: Accomplishing great things, by things deemd weak
10487: Subverting worldly strong, and worldly wise
10488: By simply meek; that suffering for Truths sake
10490: And to the faithful Death the Gate of Life;
10491: Taught this by his example whom I now
10493: ¶To whom thus also th' Angel last repli'd:
10494: This having learnt, thou hast attaind the summe
10495: Of wisdom; hope no higher, though all the Starrs
10496: Thou knewst by name, and all th' ethereal Powers,
10497: All secrets of the deep, all Natures works,
10498: Or works of God in Heav'n, Air, Earth, or Sea,
10499: And all the riches of this World enjoydst,
10500: And all the rule, one Empire; onely add
10501: Deeds to thy knowledge answerable, add Faith,
10502: Add Vertue, Patience, Temperance, add Love,
10503: By name to come call'd Charitie, the soul
10504: Of all the rest: then wilt thou not be loath
10505: To leave this Paradise, but shalt possess
10506: A Paradise within thee, happier farr.
10507: Let us descend now therefore from this top
10508: Of Speculation; for the hour precise
10509: Exacts our parting hence; and see the Guards,
10510: By mee encampt on yonder Hill, expect
10511: Thir motion, at whose Front a flaming Sword,
10512: In signal of remove, waves fiercely round;
10513: We may no longer stay: go, waken Eve;
10514: Her also I with gentle Dreams have calm'd
10515: Portending good, and all her spirits compos'd
10516: To meek submission: thou at season fit
10517: Let her with thee partake what thou hast heard,
10518: Chiefly what may concern her Faith to know,
10519: The great deliverance by her Seed to come
10520: (For by the Womans Seed) on all Mankind.
10521: That ye may live, which will be many dayes,
10522: Both in one Faith unanimous though sad,
10523: With cause for evils past, yet much more cheer'd
10524: With meditation on the happie end.
10525: ¶He ended, and they both descend the Hill;
10527: Lay sleeping ran before, but found her wak't;
10528: And thus with words not sad she him receav'd.
10529: ¶Whence thou returnst, & whither wentst, I know;
10530: For God is also in sleep, and Dreams advise,
10531: Which he hath sent propitious, some great good
10532: Presaging, since with sorrow and hearts distress
10533: Wearied I fell asleep: but now lead on;
10534: In mee is no delay; with thee to goe,
10535: Is to stay here; without thee here to stay,
10536: Is to go hence unwilling; thou to mee
10537: Art all things under Heav'n, all places thou,
10538: Who for my wilful crime art banisht hence.
10540: I carry hence; though all by mee is lost,
10541: Such favour I unworthie am voutsaft,
10542: By mee the Promis'd Seed shall all restore.
10544: Well pleas'd, but answer'd not; for now too nigh
10545: Th' Archangel stood, and from the other Hill
10546: To thir fixt Station, all in bright array
10547: The Cherubim descended; on the ground
10549: Ris'n from a River o're the marish glides,
10550: And gathers ground fast at the Labourers heel
10551: Homeward returning.  High in Front advanc't,
10552: The brandisht Sword of God before them blaz'd
10553: Fierce as a Comet; which with torrid heat,
10554: And vapour as the *Libyan* Air adust,
10555: Began to parch that temperate Clime; whereat
10556: In either hand the hastning Angel caught
10557: Our lingring Parents, and to th' Eastern Gate
10558: Let them direct, and down the Cliff as fast
10559: To the subjected Plaine; then disappeer'd.
10560: They looking back, all th' Eastern side beheld
10561: Of Paradise, so late thir happie seat,
10562: Wav'd over by that flaming Brand, the Gate
10563: With dreadful Faces throng'd and fierie Armes:
10564: Som natural tears they drop'd, but wip'd them soon;
10565: The World was all before them, where to choose
10566: Thir place of rest, and Providence thir guide:
10567: They hand in hand with wandring steps and slow,
